title: AFK and feeding?
body: Played meter yi mid you know the normal stuff with some team mates right, then at the corner of my eye i see our shaco (jg) giving first blood with the first word coming out of his friends saying "don't report him he is just AFK and walking into enemy base cause he don't want to get 20 min ban" and i was like O_O are u serious wut is this. tho me and the opponent decided to report that shack like normal people would his friend (trynd) flamed my team and started defending that guy. Wut even is this the guy went 0.28.0 and he was AFK feeding cause he didn't want to get a 2o min ban so instead he is going to ruin the whole game like are u serious. Can i have an official rioter to answer me pls i rly want to know if the guy ended up getting banned or not i just...ugh that was my second game in a row i had an AFK and i don't even think they know that its punishable i wish i could like the pic but i don't rly know how just check my match history where i played master yi and went 10.8 u will see the shaco who was "AFK" but still fed

replies.body:
The best thing you can do is to report players for this in the end of game screen. 

If they keep doing it they'll be detected by the Instant Feedback System and face punishment for it. You can help that system by reporting this and any other negative behaviour you see in game.

Hey dude,

The best thing you can do is to report players for this in the end of game screen.
It is quite easy to tell their a troll by looking at their match history, but riot has a few things that go deeper than that. 

A human will hand out bans, and the automatic tribunal system that detects reports, and other things will kick in,

Afk and feeding is against the summoners code.
Not the EULA however. Probably wont get punished for it.
I agree, they should fix it.

Reporting in post game is still the best way to see that they get whatever punishment is appropriate. If you forgot to report post game or have extra info you can submit a support ticket here:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

It's also worth noting that if a report is ambiguous or for cases involving in game behaviour rather than chat (which is harder for the automated system) sometimes a rioter will take a look. What this means is that if you add a description to your report you help them out by making it much clearer what was going on (as they don't have any means to review the games). So especially in cases like this, always describe what happened in the post game report, as it can be the extra piece of info that guarantees a punishment for that person.
People wont and dont get banned for things like this, check his match history and you'll continue to see him play games.
